title: Sources: Cowboys near trade for Bengals' Wilson
content: The Cowboys are finalizing a trade to acquire linebacker Logan Wilson from the Bengals, sources told ESPN.

title: Bucks back Turner with win after ex-Pacer booed

title: Morant mum on feelings after return from ban

title: Gannon: Brissett still backup after win vs. Dallas
content: Despite Jacoby Brissett leading the Cardinals to their first win since mid-September, coach Jonathan Gannon said he isn't changing course on his starting quarterback.

content: The Ravens are acquiring edge rusher Dre'Mont Jones from the Titans in exchange for a conditional fifth-round pick, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Conte, architect of BALCO scandal, dies at 75
content: Victor Conte, the architect of a scheme to provide undetectable performance-enhancing drugs to professional athletes, including baseball stars Barry Bonds, Jason Giambi and Olympic track champion Marion Jones decades ago, died Monday. He was 75.

title: C's Brown irate at apparent no-call: 'Unacceptable'

Cultural Affairs Minister vows to engage industry stakeholders to promote higher-quality children’s cinema in future

title: Former Karnataka minister H.Y. Meti passes away in Bengaluru
content: Meti, an influential Kuruba community leader from Northern Karnataka, was elected to the Legislative Assembly in 1989 and 2004. He served as the Excise Minister in the previous Siddaramaiah government (2013-18).

title: Mandhana, Jemimah, Deepti named in ICC Women's World Cup Team of Tournament
content: Named Player of the Tournament, Deepti was instrumental in India's title-winning campaign; she finished as the leading wicket-taker and scored crucial runs across the tournament.

title: Watch: Coimbatore assault case: Three arrested, shot while fleeing police
content: Police in Coimbatore arrested three men accused of sexually assaulting a 20-year-old college student near the city’s international airport on November 2. Officials said the suspects were shot in the legs when they tried to escape during the operation.

title: ED searches in Nagaland human hair export FEMA case
content: Despite considerable lapse of time, the company failed to submit requisite export documentation such as shipping bills, export invoice copies amongst others to the authorised dealer bank within prescribed timelines, ED officials said.

title: Women’s World Cup: PM Modi to felicitate Indian squad on November 5
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India is unlikely to organise a victory parade for Harmanpreet’s Hurricanes

title: In challenge against SIR expansion, DMK flags exercise infringes voters' right to political expression

title: Ex-Minister On Why He Didn't Speak To Mumbai Hostage Taker, Despite His Demand
content: During the three-hour hostage crisis in Mumbai in which 17 children and two adults were held captive by filmmaker Rohit Arya at a studio, he kept asking to speak to former school education minister Deepak Kesarkar.

title: On Camera, Reality Show Dancer Killed As Truck Rams Parked Car Near Bengaluru
content: A 36-year-old dancer, who appeared in several television reality shows, was killed after a truck rammed into him when he stopped his brand new car on the side of a highway to investigate a snag.

title: DMK Takes Back Ex-Minister Ousted From Party Over "Disgusting" Remarks On Women
content: Former Tamil Nadu Forest Minister and senior DMK leader K Ponmudy, who was sacked from his party position over misogynistic remarks in April this year, was reinstated as one of the party's Deputy General Secretaries on Tuesday.

title: Hyderabad Woman Kidnaps Husband, Demands 1 Crore. She Planned To Kill Him
content: Telangana Police have arrested 10 people, including a woman, for allegedly kidnapping her husband and demanding a Rs 1 crore ransom in Hyderabad. Three cars, two two-wheelers, and several cell phones were seized from the accused.

title: "No Brother In Battleground, Only Enemy": 'Fredo' Tej Pratap Yadav's War Cry
content: Social media handles are drawing parallels between the Godfather character and Tej Pratap Yadav, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) patriarch Lalu Yadav's eldest son

title: Jesus, Not Virgin Mary, Saved The World, Vatican Says
content: Jesus may have heard words of wisdom from his mother Mary, but she did not help him save the world from damnation, the Vatican said on Tuesday.

title: Give Rs 2,000 Notes, Make Money Rain: Scam Busted In Bengaluru, 10 Arrested
content: Police have arrested ten people for allegedly cheating the public by collecting withdrawn Rs 2,000 denomination notes from unsuspecting citizens and promising to make it rain money through rituals.

title: Air India Sends Relief Flight To Mongolia To Bring Stranded Passengers
content: Air India on Tuesday said it will operate a relief flight to ferry the passengers of the San Francisco-Delhi flight, which was diverted to Mongolia due to a suspected technical issue.

title: Celina Jaitly "Grateful" For Court Order For Aid To Brother Detained in UAE
content: Actor Celina Jaitly has expressed deep gratitude following the Delhi High Court's recent notice to the Ministry of External Affairs regarding her brother, Maj. (Rtd.) Vikrant Kumar Jaitly, who has been in detention in the UAE since 2024.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Israel Calls India A Global Superpower, Says Ties "Stronger Than Ever"
content: Israel's Foreign Minister Gideon Sa'ar described India as a "global superpower" and said that relations between the two democracies are "stronger than ever", spanning from defence and innovation to counterterrorism and trade.

title: Former Cricketer Azharuddin Gets Minorities Welfare Portfolio In Telangana
content: Mohammed Azharuddin, who took oath as a minister in the Telangana Cabinet, was on Tuesday allotted the portfolios of Minorities Welfare and Public Enterprises.

title: Can Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party Flip Bihar's Political Script?

title: 8 In 10 Indians Embrace Return To Office Policy, 50% Experience Burnout: Report
content: More than 8 in 10 Indians have expressed positive sentiment in returning to office (RTO), with flexibility, well-being major concern, according to a report.

content: After the Bombay HC order, the BMC recently allowed controlled feeding of pigeons at four locations — Worli Reservoir, the mangrove area on Lokhandwala Back Road in Andheri West, the Airoli-Mulund check post area, and Gorai ground in Borivali West

content: Unseasonal rains that began in the last week of October damaged crops in several districts. Survey operations were launched to assess the extent of damage

content: The vacant areas along a mud road linking Brindhavan Nagar and SIHS Colony have become a hotspot for drinking, substance abuse: residents

content: Mr. Sidhu stated that under the pretext of improving the functioning of Panjab University, the Central government has almost eliminated the representation of teachers, principals, and alumni in its syndicate

content: Mr. Tharoor said that when political power is determined by lineage rather than ability, commitment, or grassroots engagement, the quality of governance suffers

content: All top leaders of the NDA and Mahagathbandhan were busy touring Bihar and trading barbs as the campaign for the polls intensified

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta heads to Bihar for three-day campaigning in Assembly polls
content: Ms. Gupta will address a public meeting in Bankipur Assembly constituency, after reaching the State capital Patna. She will also campaign in Siwan, Barharia, Baikunthpur and nearby areas on 4 November

title: BJP delegation meets ECI officials, demands vetting of Bengal government’s citizenship documents for SIR
content: The memorandum submitted by the BJP leadership to the ECI stated that ground realities in West Bengal are different from Bihar and alleged that the State has witnessed large-scale issuance of backdated and forged documents which should be vetted during SIR

title: Take proactive steps to reduce pollution, SC tells authorities
content: Amicus curiae and senior advocate Aparajita Singh highlighted media reports indicating that several air quality monitoring stations in Delhi had not functioned during the Deepavali festival days.

content: Months ago, Patnaik, a former accountant general, played key role in leading BJD’s charge on alleged discrepancy and irregularities in 2024 elections and how it benefited BJP

title: Mushrooms key to achieving nutritional security, says UAS-B VC
content: ‘Even though mushroom cultivation is a promising venture, the existing market in India was very limited compared to China and other countries’

title: M.P. govt. wants to opt out of decentralised procurement system
content: Congress slams Bharatiya Janata Party government, accuses it of betraying farmers and pushing them “into a serious crisis”; State says “government is committed to purchasing every grain“

title: Bombay HC clears way for 26/11 mastermind Abu Jundal’s trial
content: Judge quashes order passed by trial court asking the authorities to produce documents related to the arrest of the accused

title: Karnataka announces ₹600 crore fund to push ‘Deep Tech Decade’
content: This initiative reflects our vision to create a robust DeepTech pipeline supporting entrepreneurs working on technologies such as AI, ML, quantum computing, advanced manufacturing, robotics, and sustainability-driven innovation, says Priyank Kharge

title: BJP formed govt. with stolen votes, alleges former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik
content: BJP government is not a game-changer but a name-changer — a government busy only in rebranding welfare schemes started during BJD government, claims Patnaik

title: Researchers at IIT-M and Ohio State varsity develop AI framework that mimics real-time chemical synthesis
content: They say the framework, named PURE, promises to cut down early stage timelines of drug development, which is sometimes a decades-long process that costs millions of dollars

title: Set up SIT to probe doctor’s death, Supriya Sule urges Fadnavis
content: Doctors’ association calls for systemic reforms to ensure the mental well-being of medical professionals serving in government healthcare institutions

title: Cong government spared no one in its cheating: KTR
content: He said the the government was targeting the poor through the HYDRAA drive, which would raze houses in Borabanda as well if the ruling party secures the seat

title: Allahabad High Court orders ₹50,000 compensation for man jailed in false anti-conversion case
content: The Bench said the case was an example of the “State authorities falling and scrambling over each other in order to score brownie points” on the basis of an FIR

title: 'From Delhi to Dubai': Interpol's red notice against cartel heir; wanted in Rs 13,000cr drug haul
content: Interpol has issued a Red Notice for Rishabh Baisoya, a fugitive linked to a massive Rs 13,000-crore cocaine seizure. Believed to be in the Middle East, Baisoya is accused of facilitating drug transportation for his father's international cartel. Authorities are pursuing a global manhunt and a trial in absentia.

title: 'Be ready': Mamata leads anti-SIR rally; Abhishek says 'fear claimed 7 lives'
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee led a massive protest in Kolkata against the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, alleging "silent invisible rigging" by the BJP and Election Commission. The TMC claims the revision, the first since 2002, is a ploy to manipulate voter lists before the 2026 Assembly elections, while the BJP hails it as a transparency measure.

title: 4 sixes, 93 runs! Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive reply to India A call-up
content: Teenage batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi impressed on his India A call-up, scoring a rapid 93 off 67 balls in a Ranji Trophy match. The 14-year-old's fiery innings, featuring nine fours and four sixes, showcased his aggressive batting style. Suryavanshi will also feature in the upcoming Rising Stars Asia Cup in Doha.

title: 'Bachaa hai': Tej Pratap's 'jhunjhuna' jibe at Tejashwi; threatens to campaign in Raghopur
content: JJD chief Tej Pratap Yadav called his younger brother and Mahagathbandhan's chief ministerial nominee, Tejashwi Yadav, "still a child." He vowed to campaign in Tejashwi's constituency in retaliation for Tejashwi campaigning in his. Tej Pratap also criticised Rahul Gandhi, suggesting he was unfit for politics.

title: Big AI freebie: ChatGPT Go now free for 12 months in India; how to claim the offer
content: OpenAI is offering ChatGPT Go free for 12 months to users in India starting November 4, 2025. Eligible users include new sign-ups, free-tier users, and existing ChatGPT Go subscribers with accounts in good standing. The promotion provides access to GPT-5, advanced image generation, file uploads, data analysis tools, and custom GPTs at no cost. Users must add a payment method to redeem but won't be charged during the promotional period. This limited-time offer can be redeemed via web, Android, or iOS platforms.

title: Read: How 9/11 shaped the 'Cheney doctrine'
content: On the morning of September 11, 2001, Cheney was in the White House while President George W. Bush was in Florida. As hijacked planes struck New York and Washington, the vice president was ushered into the Presidential Emergency Operations Center beneath the West Wing.

title: 'War on terror' architect: Former US VP Dick Cheney dies at 84; served under George Bush
content: Former US Vice President Dick Cheney, a key architect of the "war on terror" and influential figure during the George W. Bush administration, has passed away. Known for his decades as a powerful Washington player, Cheney later became a vocal critic of Donald Trump, deeming him a significant threat to the nation.

title: Hinduja Group chairman Gopichand P Hinduja, 85 years old, passes away in London
content: Gopichand P Hinduja, Chairman of the Hinduja Group, has passed away in London. He was 85 years old. Hinduja was instrumental in transforming the family business into a global conglomerate.

title: Google's Holiday 100: What people are shopping for; what it says about us
content: Each year, the Holiday 100 sorts people into six archetypes — the Homebody, the One with Style, the Traveller, the Beauty Maven, the Fitness Fan, and the Little One. Each category is a psychological portrait disguised as a shopping guide.

title: 'If they make too much fuss …': Lalan Singh’s warning sparks row; FIR filed after video examination
content: Union minister Lalan Singh has sparked controversy by urging Janata Dal (United) workers to confine opposition leaders on polling day.  The Rashtriya Janata Dal condemned the remarks, accusing the minister of undermining the Election Commission. This statement comes amid campaigning for a JD(U) candidate currently in jail.

title: 'Put on a whole show about Chhath Puja': Rahul’s ‘drama’ barb at PM Modi; takes swipe at Nitish
content: Rahul Gandhi accused PM Modi of staging a Chhath Puja 'drama,' alleging a special pipe was used for his Yamuna bath. Gandhi also criticized Modi for distracting youth with social media, diverting attention from unemployment and health issues. This exchange occurs amidst a heated Bihar election campaign where Modi had previously targeted the opposition over the festival.

title: IPL trade: What is preventing a KL Rahul switch to KKR - roadblocks in the way
content: Trade talks for KL Rahul ahead of the IPL mini-auction are intensifying, with Kolkata Knight Riders keen on acquiring the wicketkeeper-batter. However, Delhi Capitals are demanding a player of similar stature in return, creating a significant roadblock. DC are already close to a swap involving Sanju Samson and Tristan Stubbs and an uncapped India player.

title: China shuts door: Nvidia CEO warns US risks losing global AI edge
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the US government to reconsider restrictions on China, warning that barring the company from the Chinese market risks ceding AI talent to rivals. Despite significant losses in China due to US export controls, Nvidia is securing major deals with the US Department of Energy, including supercomputers for national security.

title: Diversification strategy bears fruit! Non-US markets offset some US export losses
content: India's export diversification strategy is showing early success following a 50% US tariff. Sectors like cotton garments, marine products, and tea are finding new markets in Asia, Europe, and the Middle East, offsetting declines in US shipments. This shift is seen as healthy for India's export growth.

title: New regional force? Northeast parties announce merger; Conrad Sangma leads charge
content: Leaders from four Northeast regional parties, including Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma, have announced plans to merge into a single political entity. This move aims to amplify the region's voice and represent its people's aspirations. A committee will now define the structure and strategy for this historic unification, though some key regional players are currently not participating.

title: Hydrogen can make water on alien worlds: A study just rewrote how planets form oceans
content: Astronomers now understand that water-rich planets can form internally, even close to stars. A new study reveals that high-pressure reactions between hydrogen and molten rock within sub-Neptunes generate vast amounts of water. This discovery challenges previous notions of planetary formation and habitability, suggesting that 'dry' planets can indeed become 'wet' worlds through internal processes.

title: Blake Treinen’s viral Charlie Kirk hat: What’s the real story?
content: A viral photo of Blake Treinen wearing a "Charlie Kirk" hat was falsely linked to the Dodgers' 2025 World Series win. The image actually dates back to a September 12 game, weeks before the championship, honoring a fallen TPUSA founder. Fact-checkers confirmed Treinen did not wear the tribute hat during the World Series celebration.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams “disgusting” Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
content: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: Diamond jewellery & solar panels! IND women rewarded royally; 297% hike in prize money
content: A Surat industrialist is celebrating the Indian women's cricket team's World Cup victory with a unique gift. Each player will receive handcrafted jewellery among other rewards. This gesture, aimed at appreciating their resilience and inspiring millions, highlights a commitment to uplifting both people and the planet. The team's historic win has sparked widespread celebrations.

title: Explosion at Pakistan supreme court: Gas cylinder blast leaves 12 injured - video
content: A gas cylinder blast rocked the Supreme Court of Pakistan's basement cafeteria in Islamabad early Tuesday, injuring about a dozen people. Authorities confirmed a gas leak and ongoing air conditioning repairs as likely causes. The explosion caused the building to shake, with the most severe injuries sustained by technicians. Emergency services responded swiftly, and investigations are underway.

title: Super Bowl LX backlash as 100K fans petition to replace Bad Bunny with George Strait
content: A Change.org petition with over 100,000 signatures is demanding the NFL replace Bad Bunny with country artists for the Super Bowl LX halftime show. Critics cite concerns about family-friendliness and national identity, while the NFL defends the choice for global appeal, highlighting Bad Bunny's immense popularity and economic impact.

title: '43yrs in maximum-security prison': Indian-origin man wrongly jailed in US; court halts deportation
content: Indian-origin man, Subramanyam Vedam, faces deportation from the US after spending over four decades in prison for a murder conviction later overturned.  Despite being a legal permanent resident since infancy, he was taken into immigration custody upon release. Courts have now halted his deportation, offering a glimmer of hope for the exonerated man.

title: San Francisco–Delhi flight: Air India to send relief plane; 228 stranded in Mongolia
content: Air India is dispatching a special relief flight to Ulaanbaatar to bring back 228 passengers stranded after their San Francisco-Delhi flight diverted due to a technical issue. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner will ferry the passengers home on Wednesday. The airline is ensuring passenger comfort and safety while the original aircraft undergoes checks.

title: ‘Rs 100 crore assets’: UP DySP hidden empire busted; SIT links him to Kanpur extortion gang
content: A Deputy Superintendent of Police in Uttar Pradesh, Rishikant Shukla, faces a vigilance inquiry after an SIT probe uncovered nearly ₹100 crore in alleged illegal wealth. The investigation revealed links to a Kanpur-based lawyer's extortion syndicate, which reportedly used fabricated cases and land grabbing. Shukla's assets are deemed disproportionate to his known income.

title: Kayla Harrison net worth 2025: UFC career, earnings, and latest match updates
content: Kayla Harrison, a two-time Olympic judo champion, has conquered the UFC, clinching the women's bantamweight title in June 2025. Her impressive victory over Julianna Peña, secured by submission, has cemented her status as a formidable force in mixed martial arts.  Harrison's journey, marked by dedication and a winning spirit, continues to inspire.

title: 'A Quiet Place: Day One': OTT release date and where to watch the Lupita Nyong'o starrer
content: A Quiet Place: Day One, starring Lupita Nyong'o and Joseph Quinn, is now available on Netflix. The film explores the beginning of the alien invasion in New York City. Critics have given it a mixed review. Meanwhile, A Quiet Place Part III, directed by John Krasinski, has had its release date moved to July 30, 2027.

title: 'Never stop dreaming': Harman’s heartfelt message after historic World Cup win – watch
content: Harmanpreet Kaur's childhood dream materialized as India clinched their maiden World Cup title, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. Recalling her humble beginnings with a modified bat, Kaur emphasized the power of unwavering dreams and perseverance.

title: Bihar: Bridge collapses in Araria; built in 2019 for Rs 4 crore, traffic movement halted
content: A middle pillar of a four-crore rupee bridge in Bihar's Araria district collapsed on Monday, causing no injuries. The bridge, built in 2019 and connecting Forbesganj with Pategna village, has had all traffic halted. A technical team is investigating the incident, which follows a dozen bridge collapses in the state last year.

title: 'Seven cut out of my face': Michael Clarke reveals long battle with cancer
content: Former Australian cricket captain Michael Clarke has revealed his ongoing battle with skin cancer, having had multiple melanomas and cancerous spots removed from his face and body since 2006. He recently underwent another procedure for a lesion on his nose, emphasizing the importance of regular check-ups and early detection due to years of intense sun exposure during his playing career.

title: Paige Spiranac gets emotional over how online hate ruined her dream career
content: Golf influencer Paige Spiranac shared a disturbing online message. She became emotional discussing the impact of hate. Spiranac detailed her efforts at The Internet Invitational. Negative comments brought back insecurities. She spoke about the hidden cost of fame and online negativity. She took to her Instagram and shared a screenshot of the disturbing message and explained the entire matter about it in the following slides.

title: Former Karnataka minister and senior Congress leader HY Meti passes away
content: Former Karnataka excise minister and senior Congress leader H.Y. Meti has passed away at 79. A five-time MLA and one-time Lok Sabha member, Meti was a prominent figure in North Karnataka politics. He had previously resigned from the cabinet in 2016 following a controversy.

title: 'Gutted!': Ashwin ruled out of BBL; Thunder issue statement on injury
content: Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has been ruled out of the upcoming Big Bash League season due to knee surgery. Sydney Thunder expressed disappointment but hopes Ashwin can still contribute later in the tournament. Ashwin, also disappointed, aims to recover and return stronger, expressing gratitude for the club's support and warmth from fans.

title: IPL Auction: SRH to release Klaasen? Franchises keep tabs on ex-Proteas batter
content: Heinrich Klaasen, retained for Rs 23 crore, produced 487 runs in IPL 2025 but majority of his runs came in two knocks with rest littered in cameos. A season prior, he scored four fifties in run to the final for SRH. Going into the mini auction next month, Klaasen could be released to beef up the purse.

title: Exclusive: Sonakshi Sinha opens up about interfaith wedding with Zaheer Iqbal
content: Sonakshi Sinha and Zaheer Iqbal, married in June 2024, have become a beloved B-town couple, with Sinha emphasizing that love triumphs over hate.  They recently humorously addressed pregnancy rumors and Sinha also commented on weight gain post-marriage, attributing it to marital happiness.

title: Diane Ladd dies at 89: Battled a life-threatening lung illness six years ago
content: Veteran actress Diane Ladd, celebrated for her roles in 'Chinatown' and 'Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore,' has passed away at 89. Her daughter, Laura Dern, confirmed her mother's peaceful passing at home. Six years prior, Ladd bravely battled a life-threatening lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, a struggle she and Dern later shared, highlighting their strengthened bond.

title: Faridabad horror: 17-year-old girl shot by jilted lover; attack caught on cam
content: A 17-year-old student was shot by a motorcyclist in Faridabad's Shyam Colony while returning from a library. The assailant fired a country-made pistol, hitting her shoulder and hand. Locals attempted to apprehend the fleeing attacker, who discarded his weapon. The girl is stable and receiving treatment. Police are investigating the motive and have identified a suspect.

title: ‘Nothing short of massacre’: Eyewitness recalls Jaipur dumper horror that killed 14
content: A horrific accident unfolded in Harmada, Jaipur, when a rogue dumper truck, careening at over 100 km/h, collided with 17 vehicles, tragically claiming 14 lives and injuring 13 others. Eyewitnesses reported the driver appeared to be under the influence of alcohol.

title: Chiefs stars Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce invite fans to dine at 1587 Prime
content: Kansas City Chiefs stars Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce are hosting Thanksgiving at their steakhouse, 1587 Prime, on November 27. Reservations open November 4. A recent Business Insider review highlighted the restaurant's ambient lighting, unique cocktails, and local partnerships, with a special nod to Taylor Swift. The dining experience for four cost around $800.

title: Rs 2.2L tax penalty on retired govt employee: Gratuity exemption under dispute
content: A retired government employee successfully appealed a penalty after mistakenly claiming an excess gratuity tax exemption. The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled in her favor, stating no misreporting occurred and she qualified for immunity under Section 270AA for paying the assessed tax.

title: From Lahli to Navi Mumbai: Shafali Verma's return gift to idol Sachin
content: Twelve years after a nine-year-old Shafali Verma begged her father to take her to Lahli to see Sachin Tendulkar, the Rohtak girl returned the favour, gifting her idol a World Cup in his own backyard. With Tendulkar in the stands, Shafali’s bat and ball did the talking as life came full circle.

title: Indonesia’s 25000-year-old pyramid challenges the understanding of ancient history
content: A recent study claimed Gunung Padang in Indonesia is a 25,000-year-old pyramid. This challenged established timelines of human civilization. Experts questioned the findings, citing a lack of evidence. The study was later retracted. The controversy highlights debates on ancient structures and early human capabilities. It fuels imagination about prehistoric societies.

title: Betting big on gold: Central banks continue to buy gold in a big way
content: Global central banks significantly boosted gold reserves in Q3 2025, adding 220 tonnes, a 28% quarterly jump. India's RBI acquired 600 kilos, reaching 880 tonnes. Despite higher prices, this strategic move signals confidence in gold as a safe haven, with Kazakhstan and Brazil leading recent purchases.

title: Cough syrup deaths: MP SIT arrests accused doctor’s wife; booked for hiding proof, aiding husband
content: wife of arrested govt doctor is accused of tampering and destroying key evidence . she ran a medical store in her name and had been on the run for weeks . the toxic batch of the syrup was found to contain 48.6% diethylene glycol (DEG)

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: Inviga Healthcare Fund of Dr. Ajaikumar of HCG picks up 21% stake in ophthalmic diagnostics firm Forus Health
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: 'It felt like a toxic environment': Stories from four QBs and their 15 schools
content: despite the haters, we've reached a peak moment for journeyman quarterbacks across college football . nearly 40 quarterbacks from the 2020 class came back this year for one more season at the FBS level . they're 23- and 24-year-old grizzled veterans who feel even older inside their locker rooms .

title: Greatest World Series ever? No question for Dodgers-Blue Jays
content: apologies to 1991, the Los Angeles Dodgers and Toronto Blue Jays just finished the greatest World Series . it was the greatest world series because of its compelling storylines, some of which were impossible to believe . the first pinch-hit grand slam in World Series history was the first game to begiard .

title: Barnwell: Two days after Halloween, four Super Bowl contenders proved to be not-so-scary
content: four of the five favorites to win this season's title by ESPN's Football Power Index lost on Sunday . the only team in the top five to make it through the weekend unscathed was the Eagles -- who were on bye . each team has at least two losses on its record by week 9 .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close ahead of first committee ranking?
content: the college football playoff selection committee will reveal its first ranking on tuesday . teams with Would be in status below are featured in this week's top 12 projection . the 12-member selection committee doesn't always agree with the Allstate Playoff P .

title: Free agent pickups: Key adds ahead of Week 10
content: the ninth Sunday of the season featured a wild, defenseless slugfest in Buffalo . preseason top tight end Brock Bowers scored three touchdowns and a league-high 43.3 PPR points . cam Little blasted the longest field goal in NFL history .

title: Way-too-early NBA All-Star predictions﻿: Which new faces will we see in L.A.?
content: the 2025-26 season is young, but it's not too early to start thinking about which players have a chance to join that group . jamal Murray has averaged more points in his playoff career (23.8) than Wilt Chamberlain (22.5), James Harden (22.3), Dwyane Wade (22.3) and Kawhi Leonard (21.6)

title: Jayden Daniels' elbow injury: Answering the most pressing questions
content: the Washington Commanders' ugly season got a whole lot worse . Jayden Daniels was lying on the ground, in pain, after suffering a dislocated elbow . the commanders have been devastated by injuries and player absences since training camp opened .

title: Resetting the CFP tiers after Week 10 and projecting the first bracket
content: two top-10 teams fell on the road to unranked opponents . a third fell to a lower-ranked team . two-thirds of the 2025 college football season done, we now shift into Playoff Hyperdrive .

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Logan Wilson to the Cowboys
content: the 2025 NFL trade deadline is Tuesday at 4 p.m. ET . we have you covered on every deal until the final second . the seahawks are an intriguing team to watch ahead of today's deadline .

title: Cardinals snap losing streak, beat Cowboys in Dallas
content: the Arizona Cardinals beat the Dallas Cowboys 27-10 on "Monday Night Football" the Cardinals' offense looked better and more efficient, both statistically and to the naked eye . the offense topped 300 yards for the third straight game after hitting the mark just once .

title: 🏈 CFB Power Ranking: Oregon moves into top 5
content: arch Manning waited until the last possible second before firing the ball to a leaping Emmett Mosley V in the end zone . the longhorns held on for a 34-31 win . he has 674 passing yards and six touchdowns in his past two starts .

title: Chhattisgarh: Passenger train collides with goods train near Bilaspur — video
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most."
